MCPKit

Developer-friendly toolkit for building MCP servers

Why MCPKit?

ðŸŽ¨

Decorator-Based API

Define tools, resources, and prompts using intuitive TypeScript decorators. Clean, readable, and maintainable code.

ðŸ”’

Type-Safe

Full TypeScript support with Zod schema integration for runtime validation. Catch errors at compile time.

ðŸš€

Production Ready

Built-in middleware, authentication, rate limiting, metrics, and distributed tracing for enterprise deployments.

ðŸ”Œ

Multiple Transports

Support for stdio, HTTP, SSE, and Streamable HTTP. Deploy anywhere from CLI tools to cloud services.

ðŸ”§

Plugin System

Extend functionality with plugins. Built-in plugins for metrics, health checks, CORS, and more.

âœ…

Testing Utilities

Comprehensive testing package with mock clients and servers. Test your MCP servers with confidence.

Simple & Elegant

Build MCP servers in minutes with a clean, decorator-based API

import { MCPServer, Tool, Param, bootstrap, listen } from '@mcpkit-dev/core';
import { z } from 'zod';

@MCPServer({
  name: 'my-server',
  version: '1.0.0',
})
class MyServer {
  @Tool({ description: 'Add two numbers' })
  add(
    @Param({ schema: z.number() }) a: number,
    @Param({ schema: z.number() }) b: number
  ) {
    return { result: a + b };
  }
}

listen(bootstrap(MyServer));

Quick Start

1

Create a new project

npx @mcpkit-dev/cli create my-server
2

Run your server

cd my-server && npm run dev
3

Connect with any MCP client

Works with Claude Desktop, VS Code extensions, and more.
